data.title: The Christian Radio Homepage
data.meta_description: Christian radio and records first online information source for news, music, interviews, promotions and more, serving the Christian radio and record community

Barefoot Media Ministries, KTSY/Boise and KTFY/Twin Falls (88.1 The Bridge), announce Travis Culver as Program Director for the radio group. Travis has been serving as interim program director for the past several months. President, Brian Yeager, say, "Travis has proved himself to be passionate about our listeners, committed to building a strong radio brand, and innovating for the future. He proved himself above and beyond as the right person to lead as Program Director. Travis leadership has already been seen in ratings and in building a powerful programming department." (8/30)

Pictured at left Curb Records artist Natalie Grant performs at the 50th Anniversary March on Washington Coalition Aug 28th. (8/29)

WAYMedia Inc., known publicly as WAY-FM, has partnered with SkörInc, a Nashville-based digital creative agency, for the purpose of new strategic digital initiatives. The first major project they will be working on together is a completely revamped WAYFM.COM website, focused more on content. Brody Harper, SkörIncs founder, had this to say, "As a regular listener of WAY, it's a complete honor to begin this journey with them. We couldn't be more excited about this partnership and can't wait to see how we can grow together as a team. Everyone has been amazing to work with so far from the leadership, the staff to the on air talent. And Wally is okay too."

Faron Dice, WAYMedias Vice President of Content & Network Services, commented WAYMedia is so very excited to be partnering with a world-class digital agency like SkörInc. They have a passion for what we do and extensive experience working in the CCM world with many of the artists we love and play on WAY-FM. (8/29)

Curb Records artist Natalie Grant will be a featured performer at the 50th Anniversary March on Washington Coalition on Aug 28th. Other performers include BeBe Winans, along with brothers Marvin and Carvin; singer, musician and Minister Wintley Phipps; country and pop music singer LeAnn Rimes; girl group Identity4Pop; and folk singers Peter Yarrow and Paul Stookey, who performed at the March in 1963. Soledad O'Brien and Hill Harper will emcee the Let Freedom Ring Commemoration and Call to Action event at the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate the historic speech delivered by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. in 1963. The event will be carried live on ABC tomorrow. (8/27)

Family Life Radio Director of Programming Adam Nash Biddell announces Stacey Stone is expanding her position with the radio network to managing national on air promotions. With her past experience in award winning promotions, Stacey has accepted the challenge and is looking forward to working hand-in-hand with giveaway facilitators across the country with campaigns that enhance the brand.

Stacy and husband Johnny are relatively new to the Afternoon Co-host position at Family Life Radio network, Stacey has over 20 years of experience in Promotions and generating audience participation in various events and contests.

When you recognize a talent in someone on your staff, you should allow that person to grow and achieve in that area on top of what they were hired for, states Adam Nash Biddell. Stacey brings a high level of excellence in Promotions to the table and Family Life Radio is ready to raise the bar in that area. Stacey Stone is part of a fantastic team of people who serve God with their great ideas!

From the time that I sold my first t-shirt for charity at a Dallas-Fort Worth radio station to the quarterly community service projects I have created recently, God has always allowed me to use the heart He has given me in promotions, explains Stacey. Promotions can truly be the hands and feet of Jesus and I look forward to bringing to Family Life Radio the excellence my teams have achieved in the past. (8/22)

WAY Media VP of Content Faron Dice has announced the addition of Joy Summers (left) as the new network midday host. She began Monday, August 12. Dice stated, Joy is a fresh new voice in Christian radio, and I am very excited to have her on the WAY-FM network, serving all of our markets.

Network PD Jeff Connell, adds, Joy quickly made her mark on several of our WAY-FM stations over the past couple years and has already created a special relationship with the audience. I'm excited that more WAY-FM listeners will have the chance to share life with such a genuine and talented person.

According to Summers, "I am so excited for the opportunity to do middays on WAY-FM. I love connecting with our listeners and living life alongside them. I'm thankful for the opportunity to share my heart and even the craziness of my unfortunate, yet hilarious, experiences. I love my job because I get to hear from people firsthand how God is using WAY-FM in their lives and I am so grateful to even be a part of that." (8/15)

WJQK/Grand Rapids (JQ 99.3) partnered with World Mission Ministries this summer for the JQ 99 Shoe Drive. Listeners dropped of shoes at various locations across West Michigan to which the shoes will now be sold in World Mission stores. The money will buy Treasure devices that are a solar powered audio player of the Bible in various languages and Morning Show Co-Host Ace McKay elaborated saying, Its been so humbling to see families donating their shoes and knowing that the gospel will be heard around the world for the very first time. The station was able to collect over 7000 pairs. (8/15)

WFSH/Atlanta (104.7 The Fish) announces its annual Celebrate Freedom(r) concert-festival event to take place Saturday, August 31, 2013 . The event is an all-day free family event featuring Christian artists, children's entertainment, rides and exhibits. The day will begin with the Celebrate Freedom Run, which is now a Peachtree Road Race Qualifier, and conclude with Fireworks following all of the concerts. This year's concert lineup will feature Third Day, Switchfoot, Francesca Battistelli, Laura Story, Montell Jordan & Victory World Music, Family Force 5, Royal Tailor, Capital Kings, MIKESCHAIR, Lindsay McCaul, Jason Gray, Kingsdown, 7eventh Time Down and Ottoman Trip.

"This is the 6th Celebrate Freedom(r) event we have had the privilege of bringing to the Atlanta area. Our 2013 event features some of the world's finest artists and groups in the Adult Contemporary Christian format. Celebrate Freedom(r) is a place where people can bring their families to enjoy a vast multitude of fun activities along with the absolute best free concert from these world-renowned artists," says Mike Moran, Vice President of Operations, Salem Communications-Atlanta. (8/12)

The Christian Radio industry is mourning the sudden death of KKEQ/Grand Forks (Your Q FM) PD Kerri Drees (left). Air1 announces it has hired Randy Chase (left) as its new PD. Chase replaces Paul Goldsmith who exited for Salems WIND/Chicago earlier this year. Chase was last PD at Mainstream Country KCYY/San Antonio (Y100) and departed in Feb this year. It is a very exciting chapter in Air1 as we welcome Randy Chase, states K-LOVE & Air1's Chief Creative Officer David Pierce. Randy brings a wealth of programming experience that will serve both our listeners and staff in amazing ways. Randy has been an Air1 fan while living in San Antonio and therefore has a deep understanding for what we do here at Air1 as well as the vision of what we hope to accomplish in the future."

Chase joins assistant program director Cari Kates at the Air1 team. "I'm incredibly excited by the opportunity to joining such a dynamic team dedicated to great radio with a purpose," says Chase of his new role. "I'm looking forward to helping Air1 fulfill its potential as a truly transformative multi-platform medium that creates compelling content and encourages our listeners to deepen their walk with Christ." (8/1)

Spirit FM/Lynchburg announced today that Erica Parkerson has joined the team as Morning Show Co-Host. Erica replaces Linda Armstrong who retired from Spirit FM last month. Spirit FM General Manager Marc Tischart says, We are thrilled to have Erica join our team. Shes a story teller, a wife and mom. Not only that, Erica is a genuine friend and encourager as well as an entertainer. She just knows how to put a smile on your face!

Erica Parkerson will serve with Morning Show Co-Host, Michael Brown, on Good Morning Radio to create, as Erica puts it, a highly interactive, emotionally dynamic and fun morning show. I could not be more excited to be part of the Spirit FM family, exclaims Erica. Every day, we will share our stories, the listeners will share theirs, and then well watch what God does!

Erica was previously morning show co-host at WRCM/Charlotte (New Life 91.9). (8/1)

New Life Media stations WBGL/Champaign and WCIC/Peoria sent staff and almost 50 of their listeners to Honduras for a 10 day mission trip. WBGL and WCIC teamed up with the missions organization, Missions.Me with the goal of sharing the gospel with the entire nation of Honduras. A video for the movement called 1Nation1Day explains the vision and plan.

Asking the question "Can a Nation be Saved in a Day" Isaiah 66:8 Missions.Me recruited the largest missions team in history and worked with the government, every school, church and media outlet in Honduras. On July 20th that question was answered as Millions gathered at their state capitals to commit their lives to the New Honduras and to Jesus! This video gives you a glimpse of what July 20th looked like.

During the trip over 100,000 pairs of new shoes were distributed, over 3 million meals served, and gave away millions of dollars in medical treatment and supplies. Then 30,000 pastors and local churches were equipped during a one day training to continue to reach their surround communities. Also the gospel was shared with every student in every school in the nation thru dramas and testimonies. And on July 20th they all Celebrated Honduras' newest national holiday with 18 large Festivals of Hope featuring guest speakers like John Bevere, Tommy Barnett and music from Kari Jobe.

Pictured: Dominic Russo (Founder of Missions.Me) Catherine Cambra (WCIC afternoon Show Host) Gabe Bahlhorn (Missions.Me Outreach Director) Craig Norrenberns (WCIC Market Manager) Jedidiah Thurner (Missions.Me Outreach Director). (7/31)

EMF (K-LOVE and Air1 Radio Networks) have named Tricia Wickham (left) as the new Director of Marketing and Brand Communication. Wickham will work closely with all of the creative media departments in coordinating and leading their marketing efforts for each of the brands as well as handling the brand communication both internally and externally. "We are thrilled to have Tricia join our team," states K-LOVE & Air1's Chief Creative Officer David Pierce. "Tricia brings a wealth of knowledge to K-LOVE and Air1 with agency, marketing and hands-on experience with high profile national brands. We are excited to see her dive in and bring a fresh perspective of marketing to our brands and help our ministries to reach more lives."

Wickham experience includes working with clients such as Frito Lay North America, Inc., Quaker Foods, General Mills, Inc., NCAA, Bank of Portugal (Portugal), Hewlett Packard, The Microsoft Store and more. She has worked with Landor Associates, an international brand & design firm located in San Francisco; a design agency, Perspective Branding in Emeryville, CA; San Francisco agency Swirl, Inc. Marketing Group, and established her own company Wickham Brand Insights. "I am thrilled to be joining such an amazing organization and working with such a superb team," shares Wickham. "Over the course of my career, I've been blessed with some amazing opportunities, and I'm looking forward to utilizing my knowledge to help grow the brand awareness of this incredible ministry." (7/29)

In a release today, National Religious Broadcasters (NRB) says it strongly opposes performance tax legislation. The NRB expressed concern with an announcement by Rep. Mel Watt (D-NC) that he intends to introduce performance tax legislation that would place a new and unwarranted burden on many Christian radio broadcasters. Performance tax legislation would be a crushing blow to many Christian radio stations, asserted Dr. Frank Wright, President & CEO of NRB. Moreover, I respectfully suggest to Rep. Watt that such legislation is fundamentally flawed as it rests on the faulty premise that all the value in radio airplay of music flows to broadcasters  an assumption refuted by reason and experience.

Musicians receive free airplay by radio, boosting recognition and sales of their work. However, advertisers, sponsors, and program syndicators pay for placement on radio because of the substantive benefits they receive from over-the-air (OTA) carriage. The demonstrable value of radio airtime is ignored by many advocates of a new OTA performance tax. Dr. Wright continued, NRB would welcome a more coordinated collaboration with Christian music artists in order to both preserve Christian radio and to benefit the music of those artists.

NRB supports a bipartisan bill, the Local Radio Freedom Act, sponsored by Rep. Michael Conaway (R-TX) and Rep. Gene Green (D-TX) in the House and Sen. John Barrasso (R-WY) and Sen. Heidi Heitkamp (D-ND) in the Senate. The bill (H.Con.Res.16/S.Con.Res.6) opposes any new performance fee, tax, royalty, or other charge relating to the public performance of sound recordings on a local radio station for broadcasting sound recordings over-the-air, or on any business for such public performance of sound recordings, and it has attracted the support of 143 Representatives and 11 Senators thus far. (7/26)

WGTS/Wash DC has named Kevin Krueger (left) General Manager. Krueger has been GM at KGTS/Walla Walla, Washington (Positive Life Radio) for the last 25 years. Its an honor to be invited to guide the team at an industry-leading station and ministry, said Krueger, I anticipate many wonderful opportunities to serve the people of our nations capital just as we have served those in the Inland Northwest. Whatever the scale or location, it really boils down to service  one person serving another.

Krueger began his career in radio in 1982 as a student announcer at KGTS. The communications major became the stations Program Director following his graduation in 1987. The following year, Krueger was promoted to his current position of General Manager.

In addition to a strong background in radio broadcast leadership, Kevin has a passion for Christian radio ministry that is contagious, said Ed Fry, President of FaithSearch Partners. who led the nationwide search for the WGTS GM position, His professional expertise and personal commitment to service will allow him lead WGTS down a path of continued success, which honors the stations mission of outreach ministry. The GM position has been open since the passing of General Manager/Vice President John Konrad in January this year. (7/17)
